baseOffenseQuestions.text: Is the custody or confinement by virtue of an arrest on a charge of felony, or conviction of any offense?

yesResult.description: Custody/confinement by virtue of arrest on felony charge or conviction of any offense

noResult.description: All other custody or confinement situations

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the use or threat of force against any person involved?

yesEffect.description: Use or threat of force against any person

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant escape from non-secure custody and return voluntarily within ninety-six hours without committing any qualifying offense?

yesEffect.description: Voluntary return within 96 hours (7-level reduction for (a)(1) base offense level or 4-level reduction for (a)(2) base offense level)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if defendant did not commit any federal, state, or local offense punishable by imprisonment of one year or more while away

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Did the defendant escape from non-secure custody of a community corrections center, community treatment center, halfway house, or similar facility (and subsection (b)(2) does not apply)?

yesEffect.description: Escape from community facility (4-level reduction for (a)(1) base offense level or 2-level reduction for (a)(2) base offense level)

specificOffenseCharacteristics.condition: Only applies if subsection (b)(2) is not applicable and defendant did not commit any federal, state, or local offense punishable by imprisonment of one year or more while away

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant a law enforcement or correctional officer or employee, or an employee of the Department of Justice, at the time of the offense?

yesEffect.description: Law enforcement, correctional, or DOJ employee

2P1.2.title: Providing or Possessing Contraband in Prison

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the object of the offense the distribution of a controlled substance?
Is the defendant convicted under 18 U.S.C. § 1791(a)(1) and punishable under 18 U.S.C. § 1791(b)(1), and would the offense level from §2D1.1 be less than level 26?

yesResult.description: Distribution of controlled substance with mandatory minimum level 26

noResult.description: Apply offense level from §2D1.1 for distribution of controlled substance

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the object a firearm or destructive device?

Was the object a weapon (other than a firearm or destructive device), any object that might be used as a weapon or as a means of facilitating escape, ammunition, LSD, PCP, methamphetamine, or a narcotic drug?

yesResult.description: Weapon, weapon-like object, ammunition, or specified controlled substances

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the object an alcoholic beverage, United States or foreign currency, a mobile phone or similar device, or a controlled substance (other than LSD, PCP, methamphetamine, or a narcotic drug)?

yesResult.description: Alcoholic beverage, currency, mobile phone, or other controlled substance

baseOffenseQuestions.text: Was the object any other object that threatened the order, discipline, or security of the institution or the life, health, or safety of an individual?

yesResult.description: Other object threatening institutional security or individual safety

noResult.description: Default level for any prohibited object

specificOffenseCharacteristics.text: Was the defendant a law enforcement or correctional officer or employee, or an employee of the Department of Justice, at the time of the offense?

yesEffect.description: Defendant was a law enforcement or correctional officer or employee, or an employee of the Department of Justice
